did.abstract: La Maison Française is an academic center devoted to programming that encourages cultural exchange with French-speaking communities. It is part of a network grouped with the Center for French Civilization and Culture that promotes academic and cultural activity of New York University's four major spheres of French Studies: La Maison Française, the Institute of French Studies, NYU-Paris, and the Department of French Literature, Thought and Culture. La Maison Française was founded in 1957, and its programming to promote cultural exchange with French-speaking populations includes lectures, performances, exhibitions, symposia, festivals, and podcasts. The Records of La Maison Française (dated 1962-1963) consist of two scrapbooks documenting the 1962 and 1963 Carnaval de Paris, a gala benefitting the center. Scrapbooks include photographic prints and newspaper clippings of the events.
